summary: An educational video focusing on various lighting techniques and their impact on visual storytelling, led by Andy Day, a professional gaffer.

events_list.video_caption: The video opens with a scene set in a dimly lit bar, where a man in a blue shirt and glasses is seated at the bar counter, engaged in conversation with a woman. The bar is equipped with various items, including a coffee machine and a neon sign, creating a cozy atmosphere. The text overlay reads, "THE FOLLOWING MOVIE SCENE HAD NO GAFFER ON SET," indicating that the lighting was managed without a professional gaffer. The scene transitions to a split-screen view, showing the bar scene on the left and a man in a light-colored shirt on the right, who appears to be explaining the lighting setup. The text in Chinese at the bottom of the screen translates to "Only the light coming from outside the window," suggesting that the lighting was natural and unaltered. The man on the right continues to speak, gesturing with his hands, while the bar scene remains static, emphasizing the natural lighting effect. The video concludes with the man on the right summarizing the lighting technique used, with the text overlay reading, "That's the situation when I'm not on the set," indicating that the lighting was managed without the presence of a gaffer.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a dramatic, suspenseful orchestral score featuring prominent string instruments. This quickly fades into a scene with two speakers, one male and one female, in an intimate setting. The male speaker orders a "three finger" pour of Drambuie and a Maraschino cherry, prompting the female to comment on his unusually strong drink order with a questioning tone. The male then pauses, after which the audio pivots abruptly, where a new male speaker with an informative and educational tone introduces himself as Andy, a gaffer, and proposes exploring lighting techniques for film scenes. The clip then rewinds accompanied by distinct audio rewinding sound effects.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man in a black leather jacket sitting at a table in a dimly lit bar, holding a glass with a lemon slice. The text on the screen reads "首先我們從點亮些燈光開始" (First, we start by turning on some lights). The scene transitions to a wider view of the bar, showing the man seated and another man in a light blue shirt and tie standing behind the bar. The text changes to "這就是我們稱的「平光」" (This is what we call 'flat lighting'). The man in the blue shirt gestures towards the bar area, and the text continues with "這會讓被攝主體的光影消失" (This will make the shadows of the subject disappear). The man in the blue shirt then approaches a woman sitting at the bar, and the text reads "三指高的蜂蜜酒加上" (Three fingers high of honeyed whiskey). The man leans in to speak to the woman, and the text changes to "那會抹煞掉這場景的氛圍" (This will erase the atmosphere of this scene). The man takes a sip of his drink, and the text reads "光全不能表現出酒吧內的光源" (The light cannot express the source of light in the bar). The video concludes with the man in the blue shirt looking towards the woman, who is now standing and reaching up to a window, while the text remains on the screen.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a percussive sound, then a male speaker with an instructional tone starts, saying, "let's start things off by firing up some lights." A bright, flat lighting effect is described and dismissed, then a different female speaker, in a casual tone, orders "three fingerings of Drambuie and maraschino cherry". A male voice acknowledges with "Thanks Gilda", followed by the same woman clarifying, "Three fingerings". The woman questions if the orderer is "a two-fingers kind of guy", before being cut off by the male speaker who explains that using too many lights "causes the scene to lose any sense of mood". The woman questions "Another day you're trying to forget?" A male voice responds, "Another day I got to remind myself not to repeat." The first male speaker continues, discussing the lighting being too intense, then proposes "Let's take a look at this lighting setup and see what we can improve."

events_list.video_caption: The video showcases a bar setting with flat lighting, as indicated by the text "FLAT LIGHTING" at the top of the screen. The bar is adorned with various bottles and beer taps, and the atmosphere is cozy with warm lighting. A man in a light blue shirt is seated at the bar, holding a drink and appearing relaxed. The text in Chinese at the bottom of the screen discusses the benefits of flat lighting, particularly in dimly lit bars, as it reduces glare and makes the scene look more natural. The camera pans to show the bar's interior, including a bartender and other patrons, emphasizing the flat lighting's effect on the ambiance. The text continues to explain that flat lighting can highlight the right moments and create a natural look. A woman in a brown jacket is seen behind the bar, and the text mentions that the bar owner is not concerned about the lighting. The video concludes with a woman in a fur coat entering the bar, and the text notes that the shadows have shifted the atmosphere of the scene. The overall narrative highlights the impact of flat lighting on the bar's ambiance and the natural look it provides.
events_list.audio_caption: The scene opens with speech from a male, noting the abundance of lights, especially for a dive bar, and suggesting to turn some off for a more natural feel. Then the music starts, a jazzy, almost noir-style, piece that sets a mysterious mood. This is followed by a female voice asserting that a mysterious dancing lady will take care of whoever comes in next. Another male voice speaks again, noting the importance of shadows for the mood of a scene.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a woman in a red dress and a fur coat standing in a dimly lit room with brick walls and a window in the background. The text "KEY LIGHT" appears prominently on the screen, accompanied by Chinese subtitles that translate to "Adjust the angle of the key light." The woman is shown from different angles, with a light bulb icon appearing near her, indicating the direction of the key light. The subtitles continue, explaining how moving the light from the front to the side can enhance the mysterious aura of the subject. The scene transitions to a man in a white shirt and tie, holding a glass of whiskey, with the text "KEY LIGHT" and Chinese subtitles that read "This is your crazy backlight, Ron." The man appears to be in a bar or similar setting, with a red exit sign visible in the background. The video then returns to the woman, now walking towards the light source, with subtitles stating, "Look at this dancer walking towards the light source, it's unclear." The final frame shows the woman from a different angle, with the subtitles explaining that this lighting setup is completely disconnected from the previously established lighting. The video focuses on the concept of key lighting and its impact on the visual presentation of subjects in a dimly lit environment.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker discussing the artistic effects of light direction and shadows. A short instrumental tune then plays, lighthearted and jazzy, featuring a vibraphone.  The same male speaker returns, quoting, "A sliver of sunshine for you, dim day, Donnie." Another male speaker speaks, mentioning a dancing lady and poorly lit spots, followed by a puzzled, "This doesn't make sense with the lighting we've already established." An abrupt sound effect occurs.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a woman in a white fur coat standing in a dimly lit bar, with a large window and a refrigerator covered in stickers in the background. The text "KEY LIGHT" appears at the top, and Chinese subtitles at the bottom translate to "Add a small light source in the direction of the bar." The scene transitions to a split-screen comparison, showing the woman with a light source from the front and another with a light source from the bar, labeled "LIGHT FROM THE FRONT" and "WITH LIGHT FROM BAR," respectively. The Chinese subtitles explain that the light from the front is too harsh, while the bar light is softer. The woman is then shown sitting at the bar, with a bartender pouring a drink for her. The text "那樣好多了" translates to "That's much better." The bartender, wearing a white shirt and green striped tie, is seen talking to the woman, who is holding a red object, possibly a cigarette. The Chinese subtitles read "也許我們有同樣的喜好," meaning "Perhaps we have similar tastes." The video concludes with the woman looking at the bartender, who is gesturing with his hands, indicating a conversation. The atmosphere is casual and intimate, with the bar's decor and lighting creating a cozy ambiance.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker discussing the impact of light sources on shadows. He contrasts small sources for harder, more defined shadows with large sources, mentioning that it would tie everything together. Next is a transition to light, jazzy music with piano and bass, while another male speaker is heard, who jovially remarks on his drink of choice, a "Napoleon Cherry," and reveals he's been drinking it since he was seven years old. A female speaker then responds, saying they might be "cut from the same fabric." Finally, the first male speaker compares it to "a Rottweiler on fire," followed by a 'hey.'

events_list.video_caption: The video takes place in a cozy bar setting, where a man in a light blue shirt and green striped tie is seated at the bar, engaged in a conversation with a woman in a white fur coat. The bar is adorned with various decorations, including a skull flag and a neon sign, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere. The man is seen explaining the use of lighting techniques, specifically "FILL + BACK LIGHTS," as indicated by the text overlay. The video demonstrates the effects of different lighting setups, showing side-by-side comparisons of the man with and without fill light, highlighting the importance of fill light in reducing shadows and enhancing detail. The woman listens attentively, occasionally responding to the man's explanations. The text in the video is in Chinese, providing additional context to the lighting techniques being discussed. The overall atmosphere is casual and educational, with the man sharing his expertise on lighting in a relaxed bar environment.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker explaining the use of fill lights and backlights to create a highlight and lighten shadows. He demonstrates how the lawyer pops with a backlight and how the fill lights remove shadows from his face. His tone is informative and slightly formal. A jazz piece with a laid-back mood begins, featuring solo saxophone, piano, and bass. The music abruptly halts. A male speaker questions someone named "Beatrice Frittata", asking if "Frittata" is her last name. A female speaker then tells them to "wrap this up" so her "mafrittata" can go back to dancing. Her tone is slightly exasperated.

events_list.video_caption: The video opens with a woman in a pink dress and white fur coat sitting at a table in a cozy, rustic room with brick walls and a window in the background. The text "REMOVING UNWANTED SHADOWS" is prominently displayed, along with Chinese subtitles that translate to "With the current lighting setup, it's like removing unwanted shadows." The scene transitions to a close-up of a glass of liquid and a red matchstick on a wooden table, with the same text and subtitles. The focus then shifts to a hand reaching towards the table, followed by a shot of a man in a blue plaid shirt adjusting a black flag labeled "FLAG" in a room with red walls and a pinball machine. The text and subtitles continue to discuss the challenges of removing shadows. The video then shows a split-screen comparison of a couch with and without the flag, demonstrating the difference in shadow reduction. The final frames highlight the effectiveness of using the flag to block shadows without reducing the light source, with the text and subtitles emphasizing the practicality of this method.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker addressing the issue of unwanted shadows, suggesting repositioning or adjusting lights. He describes a specific shadow cast by the key light and critiques removing it with another light as unnatural, advocating instead for using a tool to control light sources. A brief pause follows, and then the audio ends abruptly with an ambiguous interjection by a female speaker.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a woman in a pink top and fur coat sitting at a bar, engaged in a conversation with a man in a light blue shirt and green striped tie. The setting is a cozy bar with brick walls, wooden furniture, and a warm, inviting atmosphere. The woman gestures animatedly as she speaks, while the man listens attentively, occasionally responding. The text on the screen is in Chinese, with English translations provided in parentheses. The conversation appears to be about lighting, as indicated by the text "TOP LIGHT" and the man's explanation of how top lighting can create harsh shadows and how practical lights can be used to eliminate them. The man demonstrates this by pointing to the lights above the bar, emphasizing their role in the lighting setup. The video captures the dynamic interaction between the two individuals, highlighting their discussion on lighting techniques in a bar setting.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a female speaker asking, "Is the toast in your pocket?" in a curious tone, followed by a male speaker's reply in a conversational tone, stating "I'm sorry I don't follow," and the female repeating, "Toast in your pocket." Then the male speaker transitions to an explanatory tone, talking about how a lawyer is being lit with a top light, then speaking generally about lighting and the effect of unflattering shadows. He then moves on to the topic of hanging lights and what he calls "practical lights" on camera as part of a set design. Next, an ominous, suspenseful musical sting plays, heightening the mood of tension and drama. Finally, the male speaker continues, explaining that the lights help to "motivate a top-down source".

events_list.video_caption: The video opens in a dimly lit bar where a man in a light blue shirt and green-striped tie sits at the bar, conversing with a woman whose back is to the camera. The bar is adorned with various bottles and glasses, and a jukebox is visible in the background. The man gestures as he speaks, and the text 'TOP LIGHT' appears at the top of the screen, while 'VF' is displayed in the top right corner. Subtitles in Chinese appear at the bottom, translating to 'There is still honey on the top of the table.' The scene transitions to a close-up of the woman, who is wearing a brown jacket and holding a small object, possibly a cigarette. The text 'BOTTOM LIGHT' appears at the top, and the subtitles read 'Bottom light is also the same.' The woman continues to speak, and the subtitles change to 'It will create shadows under the face.' The scene then shifts to a split-screen view, showing the woman on the left and a person on the right handling a piece of fabric labeled 'BLEACHED MUSLIN.' The subtitles read 'So if we use white muslin to block the light.' The video then returns to the man at the bar, who is now looking towards the window, with the subtitles 'We will turn on the light above the unknown person.' The man stands up and walks towards the window, where a neon sign is visible, and the subtitles read 'We will turn on the light above the unknown person.' The video concludes with the man standing by the window, holding a tool, and looking out, with the neon sign still visible in the background.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a man speaking, mentioning "toast" and "honey". Another male voice then adds a humorous query, asking if "my fingies are dram Donny". A male narrator then explains the concept of "underlight" in visual settings and its effect on appearance. He describes how intense underlight can create an unnatural appearance, and how to mitigate this by diffusing the light. He further discusses using dramatic top and underlights for a specific effect, suggesting turning on a light over a character to create unflattering shadows and make him look more menacing. The speech is followed by menacing organ-type music with a slightly discordant tone.

events_list.video_caption: In a cozy bar setting, a woman with long hair tied back, wearing a white fur coat, sits across from a man in a light blue shirt. They are engaged in a conversation at the bar counter, surrounded by various bottles and a red cooler. The background features a door with stickers and a sign that reads "Ballantine." The text overlay in Chinese appears at the bottom of the screen, translating to "Now the secret is revealed" and "When should the climax be." The scene transitions to a paused frame with the text "SETTING THE TONE" overlaid, indicating a discussion about the mood or atmosphere of a scene. The conversation continues with the woman gesturing as she speaks, and the man listening attentively. The text overlay changes to "But all the light intensity is the same," suggesting a discussion about lighting. The final frame shows the text "We just need to adjust the light intensity to create the desired effect," indicating a focus on lighting adjustments to achieve a specific mood. The atmosphere remains warm and intimate throughout the video.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a woman speaking in a playful tone, asking how long until they get to the "pony show" now that "the cat's out of the bag." A man then makes a short, guttural statement. This is followed by a male narrator speaking in an instructional tone, explaining lighting techniques and how to achieve a moodier effect.

events_list.video_caption: The video showcases a behind-the-scenes look at a film set, focusing on the process of setting the tone for a scene in a bar. The scene features a woman with long hair, wearing a white fur coat, and a man in a blue shirt, seated at a bar counter, engaged in conversation. The bar is adorned with various items, including a refrigerator with stickers, a cash register, and shelves filled with bottles and memorabilia. The text "SETTING THE TONE" appears at the top of the screen, indicating the theme of the video. Throughout the video, the lighting setup is adjusted to achieve the desired ambiance, with the text in Chinese providing insights into the process, such as "在主燈前加個絲綢布就能讓光擴散" (Adding a silk cloth in front of the main light can diffuse the light) and "開掉補光燈能產生更多影陰" (Turning off the fill light can create more shadows). The video also includes a split-screen comparison labeled "BEFORE" and "AFTER," highlighting the difference in lighting and mood. The final frames show a close-up of the woman and the man, with the text "不行 我想要知道" (No, I want to know), suggesting a moment of tension or curiosity in their conversation. The overall atmosphere is one of meticulous attention to detail in creating the right mood for the scene.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male voice discussing the technical aspects of lighting in film, explaining how silk can diffuse key light, turning off fill light brings back shadows, and using a grid can direct the light. He then indicates a change by saying "There we go," and describes the scene as moodier. This is followed by a snippet of dialogue between a man and a woman in a scene. The woman is impatient, saying, "Now that the cat's out of the bag, how long till we get to the pony show?" The man responds hesitantly with, "Can I leak the snake first?" The woman objects, demanding "Did you spill the beans? I want the whole enchilada."

events_list.video_caption: The video features a woman with long brown hair, wearing a fur coat, sitting at a bar counter and conversing with a man in a blue shirt and glasses. The setting is a cozy bar with various posters and stickers on the walls, creating a casual and intimate atmosphere. The text "ADDING ATMOSPHERE" appears prominently at the top of the screen, indicating the theme of enhancing the scene's mood. The woman and man engage in a serious conversation, with the woman displaying a range of emotions from concern to contemplation. The man listens attentively, occasionally responding. The video includes a split-screen comparison showing the woman's expressions with and without haze, emphasizing the impact of atmospheric effects on the scene's mood. The text in Chinese at the bottom of the screen provides context, discussing the use of haze to create a more dramatic effect and enhance the actors' performances. The video concludes with the woman looking thoughtful, while the man continues to listen, highlighting the depth of their interaction.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male speaker describing how to create a moody atmosphere by adding "atmosphere", referring to a haze effect that separates an actor from their environment and makes light sources glow. A female voice then enters, speaking with a slightly seductive tone, asking "Did she spill the beans? I want the whole enchilada." A male voice responds, speaking in a slightly nervous tone, asking "Is this place safe? I mean, this could get me banned from the bar." The female speaker returns, speaking in a sassy tone, telling someone they're sweating more than "a chimp in a cheesecake factory". She continues with a playful tone, stating "You're getting a good slice here, honey." A sound effect of a door opening and closing abruptly ends the clip.

events_list.video_caption:
The video begins with a man in a blue shirt and green-striped tie sitting at a bar, holding a small object, possibly a card, while a woman in a fur coat sits across from him. The bar setting is cozy, with a warm ambiance and various items on the shelves in the background. The text on the screen reads "目前我們做到的是" (Currently, what we have done is) and "創造出了好的氛圍和適切的氣氛" (created a good atmosphere and appropriate mood). The scene transitions to a close-up of the woman, with the text "但是還有其它我們能做的" (But there are other things we can do). The next frame shows the woman handing a card to the man, with the text "WORKING WITH COLOR" and "顏色能增加場景的個性" (Color can add personality to the scene). The video then shows a split-screen view of the woman and the man, with the text "我們就用些粉紅色和藍色的燈" (We use some pink and blue lights). The final frame of this segment features a man in a black leather jacket sitting at a table with a drink, with the text "顏色還可用來詮釋角色的性格" (Color can also be used to interpret the character's personality).

The video continues with the man in the black leather jacket sitting at the table, holding a drink with a lemon slice. The background is dimly lit with a textured wall, creating a moody atmosphere. The text on the screen reads "WORKING WITH COLOR" and "顏色還可用來詮釋角色的性格" (Color can also be used to interpret the character's personality). The scene transitions to the same man, but the lighting changes to a red hue, casting a dramatic effect on the scene. The text remains the same, emphasizing the use of color to convey character traits. The man's posture and expression remain consistent, with his hand resting on the table and his gaze directed forward, suggesting contemplation or intensity. The video highlights the impact of lighting and color on the mood and character portrayal within the scene.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a single male speaker in a friendly tone, emphasizing the importance of creating a nice mood and appropriate atmosphere. He suggests using color to enhance the scene, mentioning pink and blue lights to simulate neon signs in a bar, and red to make a creepy character look more sinister. Afterward, a low, suspenseful, almost ominous piece of music begins, contributing to a sinister mood.

events_list.video_caption: The video opens with a close-up of a check being held by two hands, with the text 'VF' visible in the top right corner. The check is written to 'Jean Reno' for $10,000, with the memo reading 'For services rendered.' The scene transitions to a dimly lit bar where a woman with long hair, wearing a fur coat, sits at the bar counter facing a bartender in a striped tie. The bartender gestures as he speaks, and the woman listens attentively. The text '我們扯平了嗎 親愛的' (Have we settled it, dear?) appears at the bottom of the screen. The bartender then places a glass of whiskey on the counter, and the woman reaches for it. The text '親愛的' (Dear) is displayed again. The scene shifts to a close-up of the woman's hand as she picks up the glass, with the text '讓這地方充滿戲劇張力 並在這樣的場合保留真實性' (Let this place be full of dramatic tension and maintain authenticity in such a situation) appearing at the bottom. The woman takes a sip of the whiskey, and the text '但我沒放火燒了那地方' (But I didn't set fire to that place) is shown. The scene then cuts to a man sitting in front of a screen displaying the bar scene, with the text '無論是什麼類型的電影' (No matter what type of movie) at the bottom. The man gestures as he speaks, and the text '我們不但要聰明且有效率' (We not only need to be smart and efficient) appears. The video concludes with the man continuing to speak, with the text '我們不但要聰明且有效率' (We not only need to be smart and efficient) still displayed at the bottom.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a playful female voice asking, "A square, honey?", followed by an authoritative male voice replying, "Square as the pyramids, honey." A shift in tone then introduces a male voice delivering an informative commentary on lighting techniques in film, stating, "We've turned a boiler plate bar into something that better complements the mood of our script." This is quickly followed by an outraged male voice exclaiming, "I might have brought my Rottweiler into Joanne's fabrics and she might have destroyed 17 rolls of fabric, but I did not set that place on fire!" There is a brief sound of a record scratch, before the same male voice repeats, "But I did not set that place on fire!" The authoritative male voice then resumes his explanation of lighting, saying, "No matter the genre, having appropriate lighting can turn an average scene into a killer one." Sounds of shuffling or movement are heard, then another male voice utters, "Sorry, I forgot to leed the snake." The authoritative voice returns, now summarizing concepts, "None of these are steadfast rules; they're all tools that help tell a story." He concludes by emphasizing the gaffer's role in filmmaking, stating, "Not only must they be done smartly and efficiently, they must be done with the right intention."
